PROJECTSLABABOUT

Sushi Rolls

BOM

Category Item Notes
Tool Bamboo sushi mat (makisu) Required for tight rolling
Tool Sharp knife For clean, precise cuts
Tool Cutting board Stable cutting surface
Tool Small bowl of water (tezu) Prevents rice and nori sticking
Tool Mixing bowl For seasoning rice
Ingredient Sushi rice Japanese short-grain
Ingredient Sushi vinegar Rice vinegar + sugar + salt
Ingredient Nori sheets Dried seaweed
Ingredient Sashimi-grade fish Salmon or tuna (optional)
Ingredient Cooked shrimp or crab Optional filling
Ingredient Avocado Cut into long strips
Ingredient Cucumber Cut into long strips
Ingredient Cream cheese Optional
Serving Soy sauce For serving
Serving Wasabi For serving
Serving Pickled ginger For serving

Build Steps

  1. Prepare rice Cook rice. Season with sushi vinegar. Cool to room temperature.

  2. Prepare workspace Wrap bamboo mat with plastic. Cut fillings into long, thin strips. Prepare tezu.

  3. Assemble Place nori (shiny side down) on mat. Spread 1/2–3/4 cup rice evenly, leaving ~1 inch uncovered at the far edge.

  4. Add fillings Arrange fillings in a line across the center. Do not overfill.

  5. Roll Roll tightly using the mat, applying even pressure.

  6. Seal & shape Moisten nori edge with water, finish roll, gently shape into a cylinder.

  7. Cut Slice into 6–8 pieces with a wet, clean knife.

  8. Serve Serve immediately with condiments.

License: Ingredients are open; sourcing fish is the user’s responsibility.
